page.title: 11A DAY IN THE LIFE OF
page.content: ANSELM FISHER lives in Swainswick and is a pupil at Swainswick School. I usually wake at 7.30 a.m. I am lazy and go back to sleep. At 8.00 a.m. Mummy comes into my room and says "Its time to get up",but I go back to sleep again. Every Monday we go to collect Mrs. Seviour,our cleaning lady. I eat mashed up Weetabix and Cornflakes for breakfast. We jump in the car and go to School.When the bell rings we go into the classroom and read, then we have the Register.After Assembly our teacher, Mrs. Reid, talks to us. Then we do maths, reading routes, and English. We watch a T.V. programme called Junior Maths. At l2.00 it is dinner time. After dinnner on Mondays we go swimming. When we go home I have a piano lesson then I have half an hour to myself _ I talk to my teddy bears.After supper I go to bed at 8.l5
